channel.title: Latest Articles on Idclang
channel.description: Recent content in Latest Articles on Idclang

item.title: Why the current standardization of Tulu Script is a total disaster?
item.description: The Tulu language has been around a while, without a proper script on its own. However, the efforts to revive the almost obsolete Tulu-Tigalari script, which was primarily used for writing Sanskrit, helped in creating an identity for Tulu language like never before.

item.title: Arabi-Malayalam
item.description: Languages: മലയാളം Table of Contents Arabi Malayalam Orthography Vowels Consonants Vowel Markers Transliteration Images Literature Arabi Malayalam Arabi-Malayalam is a macaronic language popular among the Muslim community of Kerala, which served an import role in the spread of Islamic knowledge in Malabar.

item.title: Pacha Malayalam
item.description: Languages: Malayalam Pacha Malayalam is not an ultra purism movement or language extremism. On the contrary, it is a benefaction provided to the future by Malayalam language of the present and past.

item.title: Koya Origin Story
item.description: Languages: తెలుగు The Koyas are a Dravidian tribal community who speak the Koya Language, which is related to Gondi.

item.title: Porul Online Dictionary
item.description: Idclang started an open project to build an Online dictionary, particularly for Pure Malayalam, Tulu and Beary languages.

item.title: Beary language
item.description: Languages: Kannada Malayalam Information Country: India | Demonym: Bearis | Writing system : Kannada, Beary script, Malayalam Family: Dravidian | Branch : South Dravidian 1 | Group: Malayalam Languages

item.title: Gunjala Gondi
item.description: Languages: Telugu Tamil Malayalam and Kannada. Table of Contents Gondi Language Orthography Images Gondi Language Gondi is a Dravidian language spoken in the Indian states of Madhya Pradesh, Telangana, Maharashtra, and Chhattisgarh.

item.title: Suriyani Malayalam
item.description: Languages: മലയാളം Table of Contents Suriyani Malayalam Orthography Suriyani Alphabet Table Images Links Suriyani Malayalam Suriyani Malayalam is a liturgical variant of the Malayalam language written with a modified version of the East Syriac script.
